metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3238 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description: A double-free flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s NTFS3 subsystem in how a user triggers remount and umount simultaneously. This flaw allows a local user to crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2023.01.10').
linux-allwinner package in lunar is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
linux-aws package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
linux-kvm package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-lowlatency package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-oracle package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-raspi package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-signed package in lunar is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2023.01.10').
linux-signed-aws package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-signed-azure package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-signed-gcp package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-signed-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
linux-signed-kvm package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-signed-lowlatency package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-signed-oracle package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-starfive package in lunar is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
